verses.verse: How <WH4100> beautiful <WH3302> are thy feet <WH6471> with shoes, <WH5275> O prince's <WH5081> daughter! <WH1323> the joints <WH2542> of thy thighs <WH3409> are like <WH3644> jewels, <WH2481> the work <WH4639> of the hands <WH3027> of a cunning workman. <WH542>

Thy navel <WH8326> is like a round <WH5469> goblet, <WH101> which wanteth <WH2637> not <WH408> liquor: <WH4197> thy belly <WH990> is like a heap <WH6194> of wheat <WH2406> set about <WH5473> with lilies. <WH7799>
Thy two <WH8147> breasts <WH7699> are like two <WH8147> young <WH6082> roes <WH6646> that are twins. <WH8380>

Thy neck <WH6677> is as a tower <WH4026> of ivory; <WH8127> thine eyes <WH5869> like the fishpools <WH1295> in Heshbon, <WH2809> by <WH5921> the gate <WH8179> of Bathrabbim: <WH1337> thy nose <WH639> is as the tower <WH4026> of Lebanon <WH3844> which looketh <WH6822> toward <WH6440> Damascus. <WH1834>
Thine head <WH7218> upon <WH5921> thee is like Carmel, <WH3760> and the hair <WH1803> of thine head <WH7218> like purple; <WH713> the king <WH4428> is held <WH631> in the galleries. <WH7298>
How <WH4100> fair <WH3302> and how <WH4100> pleasant <WH5276> art thou, O love, <WH160> for delights! <WH8588>
This <WH2063> thy stature <WH6967> is like <WH1819> to a palm tree, <WH8558> and thy breasts <WH7699> to clusters <WH811> of grapes.

I said, <WH559> I will go up <WH5927> to the palm tree, <WH8558> I will take hold <WH270> of the boughs <WH5577> thereof: now <WH4994> also thy breasts <WH7699> shall be <WH1961> as clusters <WH811> of the vine, <WH1612> and the smell <WH7381> of thy nose <WH639> like apples; <WH8598>

And the roof of thy mouth <WH2441> like the best <WH2896> wine <WH3196> for my beloved, <WH1730> that goeth <WH1980> down sweetly, <WH4339> causing the lips <WH8193> of those that are asleep <WH3463> to speak. <WH1680>
I <WH589> am my beloved's, <WH1730> and his desire <WH8669> is toward <WH5921> me.
Come, <WH1980> my beloved, <WH1730> let us go forth <WH3318> into the field; <WH7704> let us lodge <WH3885> in the villages. <WH3723>

Let us get up early <WH7925> to the vineyards; <WH3754> let us see <WH7200> if <WH518> the vine <WH1612> flourish, <WH6524> whether the tender grape <WH5563> appear, <WH6524> and the pomegranates <WH7416> bud forth: <WH5132> there <WH8033> will I give <WH5414> thee <WH853> my loves. <WH1730>

The mandrakes <WH1736> give <WH5414> a smell, <WH7381> and at <WH5921> our gates <WH6607> are all manner <WH3605> of pleasant <WH4022> fruits, new <WH2319> and <WH1571> old, <WH3465> which I have laid up <WH6845> for thee, O my beloved. <WH1730>
